author: sky.cactus
content: This option came up a lot in various forms during the ASE discussions and it was always shot down due to it decreasing collision resistance.

author: sky.cactus
content: It was assumed (with good reason IMO) that collision resistance was already too weak at 80-bits and decreasing it would just make the situation worse.

author: sky.cactus
content: If you want to pursue that, I think the number one hurdle is putting forward a strong convincing argument that we don't need address collision resistance.

author: .vbuterin
content: I could make a more detailed post on "what exactly would not having collision resistance break"

author: sky.cactus
content: I think it may also help to include specifics on how much collision resistance we think we'll need in ~5 years for the various things.
